His only hope of stopping her diabolical plot is to restore the memory of his retired partner K - but his former mentor takes more than a little convincing. Sci-fi comedy sequel, directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rip Torn and Tony Shalhoub

programme.title: A Quiet Place
programme.desc: Two parents do whatever it takes to keep their children safe in a world full of creatures hunting every sound they hear. Nothing can be heard from the family hiding in silence, but all it takes is one noise and everything can go horrifically wrong. Horror, starring real-life husband-and-wife duo Emily Blunt and John Krasinski, who also directed

programme.title: King Kong
programme.desc: Maverick film-maker Carl Denham and his cast and crew board a ship bound for a mysterious island - but when they arrive, a giant gorilla carries off their leading lady, Ann Darrow. As the crew makes its way through the teeming jungle to find her, the director concocts a dangerous scheme to capture the great ape and take it back to New York. Peter Jacksons remake of the fantasy adventure, starring Naomi Watts, Jack Black, Adrien Brody and Andy Serkis, in a dual role as the ships cook and motion-captured creature

A scientist learns the world is soon to face a global cataclysm that will wipe out the human race, but finds the US president has plans to secretly save a fraction of the population, leaving everyone else to die. A writer learns of this scheme, and as the world is devastated by earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, he tries to get his family to the last safe refuge. Disaster epic, starring John Cusack and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Slingshot
programme.desc: An astronaut attempts to stay sane while on a troubled mission to Saturns moon, Titan. Director Mikael Hafstroms sci-fi thriller, starring Casey Affleck, Laurence Fishburne, Emily Beecham and David Morrissey

programme.title: Gothika
programme.desc: A psychiatrist wakes to find herself confined in the mental hospital where she once worked, accused of her husbands murder. Just when she thinks her situation could not get any worse, the spirit of a dead teenager begins to haunt her. Psychological horror, starring Halle Berry, Robert Downey Jr, Penelope Cruz and Bernard Hill

programme.title: Ferrari
programme.desc: During the summer of 1957, ex-racecar driver Enzo Ferrari is in crisis. Bankruptcy stalks the company he and his wife, Laura, built from nothing a decade earlier. Their tempestuous marriage struggles with the mourning for one son and the acknowledgement of another. Attempting to secure their survival, he rolls the dice on one race - 1,000 miles across Italy, the iconic Mille Miglia. Director Michael Manns drama, starring Adam Driver and Jack OConnell

programme.title: The Godfather
programme.desc: The patriarch of the Corleone crime family is hospitalised after an attempt on his life and entrusts control of his business to his three sons - the violent and unpredictable Sonny, the weak-willed Fredo, and Michael, the youngest brother, who reluctantly takes up the reins but proves to be the most ruthless of them all. Francis Ford Coppolas gangster drama, starring Marlon Brando, Al Pacino, James Caan, John Cazale, Talia Shire, Robert Duvall and Diane Keaton

programme.title: Escape from Alcatraz
programme.desc: A cunning convict with a history of making escape attempts is transferred to the notorious high-security island prison off the California coast, from which no one has ever broken out. Continually at odds with the brutal warden, he and three fellow prisoners hatch a plan to make it to freedom on an improvised raft. Thriller, based on a true story, starring Clint Eastwood, Patrick McGoohan, Roberts Blossom and Fred Ward

programme.title: Trap
programme.desc: A serial killer attempts to evade a police blockade while attending a concert with his daughter. Thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Ariel Donoghue, Saleka Shyamalan and Hayley Mills

programme.title: Split
programme.desc: After being abducted by a kidnapper with multiple personalities, three young women are soon engaged in a fight for survival. Meanwhile, an oblivious psychiatrist tries to ease her patients fractured mind as a 24th character with apparent superhuman abilities attempts to dominate his body. M Night Shyamalans thriller, starring James McAvoy, Anya Taylor-Joy and Betty Buckley

programme.title: The Surfer
programme.desc: A father returns to Australia to buy his childhood home. To celebrate, he takes his teenage son to Luna Bay so they can surf together. However, he becomes locked in a battle of one-upmanship with local thugs. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage and Julian McMahon

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: A retired secret agent applies his talents to the task of helping victims of injustice. When he witnesses a prostitute being beaten up by a pimp, he kills the man, an act that draws him into a battle to the death with a Russian crime syndicate. Action thriller based on the 1980s TV series, starring Denzel Washington and Chloe Grace Moretz

programme.title: The Equalizer 2
programme.desc: Robert McCall divides his time between cab driving and looking after a young man who is mixing with a bad crowd. When a CIA friend is murdered, the former black ops agent sets out to avenge her death, and winds up fighting for survival in his hurricane-battered home town. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Pedro Pascal and Ashton Sanders

programme.title: Juror #2
programme.desc: Magazine writer and family man Justin Kemp is sequestered to serve on the trial of James Sythe, who is accused of killing his girlfriend Kendall one year ago, following a fight in a bar. Justin faces an agonising moral dilemma - he was at the same pub as the defendant that fateful night, and struck something on the road during the drive home, which might have been Kendall. Clint Eastwoods legal thriller, starring Nicholas Hoult, Toni Collette, JK Simmons and Kiefer Sutherland

programme.title: Escape from Alcatraz
programme.desc: A cunning convict with a history of making escape attempts is transferred to the notorious high-security island prison off the California coast, from which no one has ever broken out. Continually at odds with the brutal warden, he and three fellow prisoners hatch a plan to make it to freedom on an improvised raft. Thriller, based on a true story, starring Clint Eastwood, Patrick McGoohan, Roberts Blossom and Fred Ward

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-Nov 2025
programme.desc: Previews of the films now playing on Sky Cinema plus other highlights showing on Sky

programme.title: The Godfather Part II
programme.desc: Mafia don Michael Corleone sets out to clinch a make-or-break deal with an ageing gangster - but his plans are blown apart by a traitor within the family. Michaels story is intercut with flashback sequences chronicling the early life of his father Vito as he makes the shift from immigrant grocery-store clerk to Mob kingpin. Francis Ford Coppolas Oscar-winning crime drama sequel, with Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, John Cazale and Lee Strasberg

programme.title: The Godfather: Part III
programme.desc: Twenty years after ordering the murder of his brother, ageing don Michael Corleone is close to fulfilling his dream of severing his familys Mafia ties and gaining legitimacy, but vengeful enemies and the actions of his hot-headed nephew soon draw him back into a life of crime. Francis Ford Coppolas crime drama sequel, starring Al Pacino, Andy Garcia, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, Eli Wallach and Bridget Fonda

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: A retired secret agent applies his talents to the task of helping victims of injustice. programme.title: The Accountant
programme.desc: Autistic number-cruncher Christian Wolff moonlights as a money launderer for the Mob. However, the Treasury Department start closing in on him, so he decides to take on a legitimate client in the form of a robotics company. As he works through their books, he uncovers a discrepancy involving millions of dollars. Action-packed thriller, starring Ben Affleck, Anna Kendrick and JK Simmons

programme.title: Layer Cake
programme.desc: A London cocaine dealer is all set to leave the criminal world behind and start a new life abroad. However, his plans are thwarted when he is asked to track down a gangsters drug-addicted daughter and locate a stolen shipment of Ecstasy. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Michael Gambon, Colm Meaney, Kenneth Cranham and Sienna Miller

Clint Eastwoods legal thriller, starring Nicholas Hoult, Toni Collette, JK Simmons and Kiefer Sutherland

programme.title: American Gangster
programme.desc: The story of 1970s drug kingpin Frank Lucas, whose innovative methods of smuggling heroin into the US made him one of the leading figures in the New York underworld. A detective is assigned to bring Lucass empire down, but his investigation is undermined by police corruption. Ridley Scotts fact-based crime drama, starring Denzel Washington, Russell Crowe, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Josh Brolin

programme.title: Sleepers
programme.desc: Four teenagers are sentenced to reform school after a prank results in the accidental death of an old man, and suffer sexual abuse at the hands of the guards. Years later, when the boys have grown up and begun to follow very different professions, a chance encounter with one of their abusers inspires them to plot revenge. Drama, starring Brad Pitt, Robert De Niro, Dustin Hoffman, Kevin Bacon, Jason Patric and Minnie Driver

The dig unearths more clues to the palaces architecture and splendour, and of Henrys life and times, with finds including the remnants of a working oven and a 16th-century groat - worth about four pence in Tudor times - featuring a portrait of Henrys face

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: Beau Ouimette and Rick Edwards take on the River Wear - a natural fortress protecting the ancient city of Durham and its sacred Cathedral, where in the 1500s Henry VIII seized power of the Church and the Cathedrals shrines were plundered. programme.desc: Significant victories against the Germans in the latter stages of the war, including the Soviet surge that pushed German forces back to within 30km of the Polish border, the lifting of the siege of Leningrad after 900 days and the Battle of Normandy

programme.desc: Throughout history, there have been stories of strange beings unlike anything known to exist on Earth. Could they be more than just mythology and if so, did they come to shape mankinds past - or its future?

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team compares the strange encounters of two men, one from Ohio and the other from Virginia, to see if there is evidence that they have had contact with extraterrestrials

programme.title: Digging Up Britains Past
programme.desc: Helen Skelton and Alex Langlands visit Sherwood Forest to learn more about the legend of Robin Hood - who may or may not have been real - and King John, who definitely was. An archaeological team digs the land surrounding the ruins of King Johns palace at Clipstone in the heart of the forest, hoping to reveal how far the royal buildings stretched. Helen and Alex also visit several of Robin Hoods supposed hideouts, as well as Nottingham Castle, where he is reputed to have been imprisoned before escaping via a secret tunnel

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.sub-title: Salisbury and Old Sarum - William the Conqueror
programme.desc: Beau Ouimette and Rick Edwards head to the River Avon at the foot of one of Britains most historic sites, Old Sarum near Salisbury. Following his defeat of King Harold at the Battle of Hastings in 1066, William the Conqueror built an imposing motte and bailey castle at Old Sarum in 1067, where hes believed to have been presented with the infamous Doomsday book. From here, Rick and Beau follow the Avon - just as the population and cathedral did, which was moved brick by brick down river. They search for Salisburys 13th-century beginnings and how it built successful trades that lead to its survival

programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones heads to the south-east of England to explore the turbulent history of Dover Castle. He reveals that Henry II ordered its construction not only as a statement of royal power, but also out of guilt for the murder of Thomas Becket, the Archbishop of Canterbury, in 1170. Dan discovers how a vast network of tunnels was used to defend the castle, including underground barracks built during the Napoleonic Wars and a nuclear bunker created during the Cold War

programme.title: Live EFL
programme.sub-title: West Bromwich Albion v Birmingham City 26.11
programme.desc: West Bromwich Albion v Birmingham City (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the Championship match at The Hawthorns. An 85th-minute Andreas Weimann goal was enough to secure a 1-0 win for the Baggies when the teams last met here in the 2023/24 season, which ultimately ended in disappointment for the Blues as they were relegated to League One

programme.title: Live NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Boston Celtics v Detroit Pistons (Tip-off 10.00pm). Coverage of the Eastern Conference match at TD Garden. After seeing star-man Jayson Tatum suffer a ruptured Achilles tendon in the play-offs last year, the Celtics opted to make this a season of transition, as they traded away a number of players to cut payroll costs and creep below the salary cap, with the aim of coming back stronger next year when Tatum is expected to return

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotlands Lochs
programme.desc: Landing at Glenuig, Paul Murton makes his way inland to Loch Moidart and MacDonald country, walking the old coffin road, which was used for centuries by funeral parties, taking their dead to a sacred isle. On the track Paul meets a trials bike enthusiast and learns the secrets of a dabbing coat before landing off the Green Isle, where he rings a 1,100-year-old bell for the dead. Taking a boat north, Paul sails up Loch Shiel to Glenfinnan where Bonnie Prince Charlie officially began his rising to reclaim the throne for the Stuart Dynasty. From a forgotten monument that commemorates this event, Paul heads back to the coast and Loch Ailort, where he learns how to knife fight before taking a trip across the loch to a deserted community on the roadless Ardnish peninsula

programme.title: Buildings Beo
programme.desc: Carrie Crowley heads to Ballinamore, Co Leitrim, where she falls in love with the towns old railway station, which has fallen into disuse and dereliction. programme.title: Worlds Most Dangerous Roads
programme.desc: Ben Fogle and Hugh Dennis undertake a perilous journey through the Peruvian Andes. Their route takes in 2,000ft drops, one-lane dirt roads, remote mountain trails and muddy, humid jungle terrain, as they search for the lost city of Constitucion, once destined to be the capital of Peru

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers intercept a shipment of hundreds of gun parts headed for Mexico, a nurse is caught smuggling pills in her boots, and a traveller carrying goat meat is inspected

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A tip-off unearths a vast shipment of heroin and cocaine disguised as garbage bags, and officers respond to a medical emergency and deal with a drunken US Marshal

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Grant teaches son Matt the dangerous game of mustering. Elsewhere, Ash takes on 230,000 volts of electricity in a high wire act of precision flying

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Father-and-son mustering team Grant and Matt clash with some tough cattle - and each other. Pilots Alex and Mick battle strong winds and high voltage power-lines

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers become suspicious when they pull over a businessman from Mexico who is making a rare journey to the United States in a brand new car

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A driver is stopped attempting to smuggle 15kg of cocaine across the border, and a truck drivers modified cab attracts attention at the World Trade Bridge

programme.title: Train Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: The construction of a 130-tonne locomotive in Newcastle is nearing the finish line, and an overnight crew must get a Brisbane train on track before the morning commute

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness each buy a sporty insurance write-off for £6,000 and take part in three challenges at the test track before theyre ordered to make their cars road legal and report to Alexandra Palace, where the producers have constructed a monstrous Wall of Death. The trio also celebrate the era of the 200mph supercar by going on a road trip in a Ferrari F40, a Lamborghini Diablo and a Jaguar XJ220

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness head to Cyprus on a budget rental car adventure and sample the exciting sport of car water-skiing. Back at the test track, Chris and Paddy check out family cars from Audi and Lamborghini

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore the food provided by British waterways as they fly-fish for trout, prepare a meal of stuffed wild duck and discover how the Gloucestershire tradition of eating baby eels has virtually disappeared

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick meets a man who is paid to eat 700 samples of cheese a week at a dairy, then heads to the unlikely setting of one of Britains most revolutionary art movements in Newlyn

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: The culinary expert is in Falmouth, where he enjoys dishes prepared by an innovative chef called Andy Tuck. Rick also meets Judy, the daughter of acclaimed author William Golding

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Bez, Motsi Mabuse, Shazia Mirza and Steve Pemberton join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds such as Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Jessie Cave, Ayesha Hazarika, Simon Hickson and AJ Pritchard go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Rickie Haywood-Williams, Sally Phillips, Vikki Stone and Dan Walker test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Joe Lycett, Phil Wang and Ellie Taylor join regular panellist Alan Davies, as questionmaster Sandi Toksvig looks at the pastimes of past times. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Charlie Brooker hosts an extended episode of the satirical current affairs quiz, with team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton joined by Grayson Perry and Angela Barnes

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by The Great British Bake Offs Paul Hollywood, TV presenter Gabby Logan and comedians Joe Wilkinson and Aisling Bea to discuss and dissect events reported as news on on social media. Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Ed Byrne, Stewart Francis, Rob Beckett and Katherine Ryan, with the panellists giving their take on the weeks major news stories by way of stand-up spots and improvised games. From 2013

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Jo Brand, Simon Day, Kiri Pritchard-McLean and Henning Wehn join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Michele and Brian are combining their design styles in his LA Spanish-style bungalow, which includes adding functionality and improving the flow of the main floor

programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team come to the aid of a couple in Worksop, Nottinghamshire, who started out building their own extension to meet the needs of their growing family, only to receive a double blow when husband Neil was made redundant and their youngest child Ben began to show signs of autism. The builders have just 10 days to bring designer Gabrielle Blackmans ideas to life - but as usual, local tradesmen and other members of the community turn out in force to help

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team head to Fareham, Hampshire, to help Haanagh and Mike, who have three children, including twins - one with cerebral palsy, the other profoundly deaf. The family house is small and the cramped conditions are making life difficult, and at times dangerous, for the growing boys. Local tradespeople and members of the community muck in to help the builders create a new single-storey extension in just nine days, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to protect her vision

programme.desc: Holmes is asked to consult on the case of a Wall Street banker who appears to have overdosed on heroin, with work-related stress and a misguided experiment being two possible explanations for the victims drug use. programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A 22-year-old woman goes into labour with her first child, and complications arise for a 37-year-old expectant mother. Fly-on-the-wall documentary observing the lives of staff at Princess Anne maternity hospital in Southampton, who - led by co-ordinator midwife Kay Duggan - help patients through the joys and sorrows of becoming parents

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The pressure becomes too much for one prospective father when midwives decide his girlfriend needs a Caesarean. Meanwhile, a diabetic mother-to-be anxiously waits to go into labour after being induced, and her frustration is exacerbated when her hospital lunch fails to arrive on time

programme.title: DNA Family Secrets
programme.desc: Stacey Dooley meets five sisters in Lancashire who only found each other as adults. They know they all share the same mother, but want to find out if they also have the same father. Luke was a sperm donor as a university student in the late 1980s. He has now come forward to find out if any potential children might be looking for him. Identical twins Diane and Louise want to test their DNA to discover if they both carry the potentially deadly BRCA genetic mutation since they lost their mother to cancer

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics are sent to help a 49-year-old who has fallen in the street after a night out in Stoke, while in Dudley, paramedics visit a five-month-old who has a temperature

programme.title: One Born: What Happened Next?
programme.desc: People who have featured on the programme share their experiences of parenthood and the challenges it has brought them, including Janet and Vicki, who were looking forward to having a child after four rounds of fertility treatment. A couple who had a girl two years ago reveal how they brought their plans for another baby forward after a cervical cancer scare, and are now expecting a boy. Plus, the chance to catch up with Nicola and Craig, who arrived on the labour ward of the Leeds General Infirmary with strict birthing rules

programme.desc: Aliya and Chris have lived in their unique home for 15 years of major milestones - they want to stay, but with only two bedrooms for five people, the house needs help

programme.desc: Renee and her husband Dan had dreams of renovating their home together as they raised their daughter, Audrey, but Dan passed. The brothers step in to help

programme.title: DIY SOS

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Since his wife died shortly after giving birth to their sixth child, Paul Makings has been valiantly holding the family together as they grieve. But hes facing even more problems - living in a two-bedroom house he has started to extend, and forced to sleep on the sofa. Nick Knowles and the team are joined by more than 100 locals in Misterton, Nottinghamshire, as they take on their biggest home build ever. However, they have to battle against a blizzard to complete the job in nine days

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz show in which four players take on an extraordinary machine in the hope of winning its 10,000 pound jackpot

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles heads to Maidstone, Kent, to meet former Royal Engineer and paratrooper Mo Morris. After 20 years in the service, he was given a medical discharge due to damage to his knees, and has been left struggling to walk unaided ever since. At present, his home is unsuited to his needs, putting pressure on his relatives as they try to help as best they can. Determined to give him back his independence, the DIY SOS team rallies the local troops, including tradespeople and neighbours, to work together and adapt Mos house, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to make sure everything goes to plan

programme.title: MasterChef USA
programme.desc: The Top 5 duos face a MasterChef rite of passage - The Wall. Both cooks in each duo must make the same dish while separated by a giant wall, and can only communicate by shouting over it

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.sub-title: Terri, Esme and the Chi Family
programme.desc: Pete meets Lurcher Terri, whos terrified of the world and must learn to trust again, and helps settle a family of chihuahuas given up by their heartbroken owner

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Miami Mega Jail
programme.desc: Part one of two. The contemplative reporter examines life in Miami County Jail, where most of the inmates are awaiting trial. He begins by exploring the large cage-like dwellings on the fifth and sixth floors, which are home to many of the most volatile prisoners. The inmates lives are governed by a gladiatorial code, leading to fights for food and status - a situation the guards say they are powerless to address

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Miami Mega Jail
programme.desc: Part two of two. The reporter goes deeper into the jail system, meeting an alleged triple murderer facing a possible death sentence. He also follows a group of younger convicts who have avoided prison by pleading guilty and attending a four-month military-style boot camp. Among them is a 14-year-old boy who may face a 10-year sentence for armed robbery if he cannot endure the harsh training and rehabilitation programme

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A woman longs to hold her baby, who was born with his bowels outside his body and has been in a critical condition ever since. Meanwhile, an expectant mother who underwent a Caesarean during the birth of her first child hopes her second delivery will go according to plan

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: A mother coping with the death of her brother goes into labour with her fifth child, and her sister discusses how the pregnancy has helped the family cope with the bereavement. Meanwhile, a woman who received IVF treatment anxiously prepares to give birth, but when her waters fail to break she is asked to consider undergoing a Caesarean

programme.title: My Family
programme.sub-title: And Ill Cry if I Want To
programme.desc: Another Christmas with the Harper family sees Scrooge-like patriarch Ben at his most miserable, as wife Susan is busy giving grandson Kenzo a third birthday to remember, his hated mother-in-law Grace gets herself a toyboy and eldest son Nick sends a present that could have a lasting effect on the entire household. Robert Lindsay and Zoe Wanamaker star, with Daniela Denby-Ashe, Gabriel Thomson, Siobhan Hayes and Rosemary Leach

programme.title: Louis Therouxs LA Stories
programme.desc: California has some of the toughest regulations controlling sex offenders anywhere in America - after leaving prison they can spend years on parole being tagged and tracked and a lifetime on an online register. In his final film exploring different aspects of life in Los Angeles, Louis Theroux visits hostels to talk to parolees as well as the people charged with monitoring them, and asks whether the restrictions keep society safer and when, if ever, it is right to give sex offenders a second chance

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his travels through London in Hampstead, where he learns more about the founder of psychoanalysis, Sigmund Freud, who fled the Austrian capital of Vienna during the Second World War and made his way London. Then, Michael pays a visit to the famous Abbey Road Studios, before making his way to Finsbury and touring the innovative and sculptural housing development, Bevin Court

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael tracks the River Thames from east to west. Starting in Dagenham, he finishes this leg of his tour at one of Londons most iconic buildings, Battersea Power Station, built during the 1930s by Giles Gilbert Scott

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo discovers the origins of Harry Becks map of the London Underground, learns about a shocking surrealist show in 1930s Piccadilly and explores the headquarters of Churchills war cabinet

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo explores the Britain of his youth, starting at Prestons Fulwood Barracks and heading to Bury Bolton Street Station in Greater Manchester

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads off to collect some vintage motorcycles from a garage at the bottom of the garden in the North-East of England

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds two rare Fiats and a VW Corrado. Derek has his work cut out trying to remove an old Morris that appears to be supporting the garage roof. What could possibly go wrong?

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How Fiat didnt just make cars, but also made trains, planes and, like modern-day kingmakers, they made and broke governments too

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Nazi occupation of Holland, which began relatively peacefully with Dutch civil servants continuing to run their own country, but eventually resulted in many thousands of deaths through the attempted elimination of Jewish citizens and starvation of the non-Jewish inhabitants. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The experts value items at Hatfield House in Hertfordshire, including a collection of ornamental pigs, dolls house furniture made from First World War shell cases and a set of three surprisingly valuable tiles. Meanwhile, Fiona Bruce goes for a drive in a Daimler Dart - the car featured in the programmes opening credits

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team head to Chatsworth House in Derbyshire, where objects awaiting valuation include a rare tile commemorating one of the biggest bare-knuckle boxing matches in history, and a Stanley Spencer portrait that is brought in by the subject of the picture. Meanwhile, an object found buried in a garden in Derby surprises everyone

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek heads to Sunderland to pick up a real Italian beauty - a 1972 Lancia Fulvia Zagato. Red and racy, the car has seen better days, but Dereks still impressed

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Up for sale at the Mathewsons auction - a 1275 Mini GT thats come from just down the road that could be a future British icon

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How Fiat didnt just make cars, but also made trains, planes and, like modern-day kingmakers, they made and broke governments too

Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce looks back at memorable finds from the past series and discovers what has happened to some of the most discussed items. The shows experts also hear from a viewer who believes she may have found one of their most wanted missing antiques - a piece of jewellery that is believed to be among the rarest of its kind in the UK

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Autumnal fog and an overheating engine prove to be problems for narrowboater Robbie Cumming. As he navigates a Roman waterway, it proves to be a journey of many challenges as he runs aground and breaks down in Nottingham

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: On the last leg of his journey across the North and the Midlands, Robbie faces issues with ice on the Grand Union Canal. He takes on Foxtons famous lock flight in Leicestershire and completes his journey in the picturesque village Braunston, Northamptonshire, regarded as the spiritual home for narrowboaters

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Exploring a complex in New Jersey infiltrated by a notorious gang, a tranquil Japanese island with a poisonous legacy, and a top-secret bunker in Lithuania

programme.title: David Jasons Great British Inventions
programme.desc: The actor operates one of the worlds biggest hydraulic cranes, gets behind the wheel of a tank, and discovers the story behind the invention of the hovercraft

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Abandoned projects of the space age, including the HARP gun in Barbados and the mountainside Barcroft Observatory in California

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: Autumnal fog and an overheating engine prove to be problems for narrowboater Robbie Cumming. As he navigates a Roman waterway, it proves to be a journey of many challenges as he runs aground and breaks down in Nottingham

programme.title: Canal Boat Diaries
programme.desc: On the last leg of his journey across the North and the Midlands, Robbie faces issues with ice on the Grand Union Canal. He takes on Foxtons famous lock flight in Leicestershire and completes his journey in the picturesque village Braunston, Northamptonshire, regarded as the spiritual home for narrowboaters

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos railway journey reaches Greater Manchester, where he celebrates new beginnings for the nation in the years after the Second World War. At Trafford General Hospital, he investigates the birth of the National Health Service. A retired physiotherapist recalls her part in the historic event of July 5, 1948. Coronation Star tells Michael about the first episode of the soap, broadcast live in 1960. And at the citys Science and Industry Museum, the presenter encounters a replica of the Baby, which was created in 1948 - the first machine in the world to run a stored program and the forerunner of all modern computers

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels by tram to the former cotton town of Oldham on the edge of the Peak District. Here he visits Oldham Coliseum, the towns Victorian repertory theatre, and hears about the lifting of censorship by the Lord Chamberlains Office in the late 1960s. He then goes hiking before a visit to Sheffield, where he attends a knife-making workshop. He ends this part of his journey admiring the striking post-war sculptures of Barbara Hepworth at the Yorkshire Sculpture Park near Wakefield

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Wakefield, West Yorkshire, Michael Portillo visits the National Coal Mining Museum for England at Caphouse Colliery. In Leeds, he heads for the Chapeltown area to investigate the origins of the Leeds West Indian carnival in 1967 and tries his hand on the steel drums

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his post-war exploration of northwest England in Bradford, Shipley and Hebden Bridge. In Bradfords Centenary Square, he encounters local literary giant, JB Priestley. At Shipley station, Michael discovers a nature reserve in the middle of the car park. Finally the Calder Valley Line delivers the presenter to the photogenic station at Hebden Bridge

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek navigates the dry stone walls of the Peak District to collect a very original 1988 Opel Manta. Plus, Dave deals with a Ford Granada rally support vehicle

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek has a three-hour drive in a 1960s bus that arrived in the UK after a life in the sun. Dave takes a Triumph TR7 convertible to auction

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: While America had Ford, Chrysler and Buick, Hitler also wanted a car that would transform his nation - the peoples car, or Volkswagen

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates an account of the liberation of Paris and Brussels in 1944, events which to many signified the end of the war. Parsnip in particular is in a bad way, with infected mammary glands as a result of a recent pregnancy

programme.title: Paul OGrady: For the Love of Dogs
programme.desc: Paul meets enthusiastic collie greyhound cross Bud, who holds the record as Batterseas most unwanted resident, having been at the kennels for more than two years. programme.title: Britains Spending Secrets
programme.desc: Anne Robinson embarks on a two-part investigation into how British people spend their money, meeting consumers from across the wealth spectrum to put their spending habits under the spotlight. The presenters sample group ranges from billionaires to benefits claimants, all of whom she accompanies on spending sprees to discover whether there is any relationship between where and how people choose to part with their hard-won cash, and their personal values. Anne begins by introducing a single mother on benefits who has fallen into debt by spending beyond her means, a super-rich entrepreneur who only believes in handing over cash for things that will increase his wealth, a baroness with a passion for thriftiness and an eco-warrior who tries not to spend anything at all

programme.title: The Group Chat

programme.title: Im a Celebrity... Unpacked
programme.desc: Joel Dommett and Kemi Rodgers are in the jungle to dig into all the camp action and are joined by a former campmate and celebrity guests to discuss all the latest goings-on - Ant and Dec will also be dropping into the studio and revealing exclusive updates.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Frank Bailey is a pet detective whose methods irk some of the villagers, so when he is found dead in the kennel of a dog he was looking for, Barnaby has his work cut out for him. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon, Nick Hendrix and Fiona Dolman

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Vernon buys a batch of topsoil for his new compost-producing business, little suspecting it is from a contaminated landfill site. The shady dealer who sold him the soil winds up dead - as do a number of local cows - and Vernon is soon fighting for his life. Elsewhere, seductive sergeant Nokes sets her sights on Steve Crane, and Bellamy wonders whether Gina will return to Aidensfield and marry him. Geoffrey Hughes, James Carlton and Mark Jordon star

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.sub-title: How to Say I Love You!
programme.desc: The whole town is caught up in romance when Cassie helps Ben find an old film for him to show on opening night of the refurbished Middleton Theater - a classic love movie from the 1930s How to Say, I Love You! - which proves to be a very meaningful title. Meanwhile, Martha has overextended herself with the Middleton budget, and there is no money left in the extra expenditure account

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King are in Northumberland, enjoying its stunning coastline and rugged landscapes. The duo visit Hjem, a Michelin-starred restaurant located within the Hadrian Hotel and run by Scandinavian-born chef Alex and his partner Ally, whos front of house. Its the Bikers job to help Alex and Ally connect with new, local producers, ones that can inspire award-winning cuisine

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: British couple Liz and Michael Callis emigrated from Britain and bought a 14-bedroom guest house in the Swiss Alps, but their hopes of a stress-free retirement have been ruined by a heavy workload. Alex Polizzi outlines her vision for the future of the hotel, including smart uniforms for the staff, a drop in food prices and a transformation for an unused formal dining room - but is unimpressed with the results when she returns a month later

programme.title: Whos Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Singer Joe McElderry hosts a dinner party for four strangers, who try to guess their mystery hosts identity, with the aim of winning a cash prize, while the famous faces try to avoid having to wash up. Hosted by Brian McFadden

programme.title: Heathrow: Britains Busiest Airport
programme.desc: Police detain a passenger whose bag is suspected to contain three firearms, Virgin has a launch party for their new route to the live music capital of the world - Austin, Texas, and passenger experience manager Hannah rushes to the aid of a seasoned traveller who takes a funny turn

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Walker and Miller struggle to decide whether an ex-Army major is guilty of murder after shooting a youth who broke into his home, while Carol tries to get through to a pregnant teenager. Rosie learns the garage is in financial trouble - unaware Peggy and a salesman with big ideas (impressionist Jon Culshaw) have already dreamed up a plan that could save it. Jonathan Kerrigan and Gwen Taylor star

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Oh! To Be in England - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Preparations get under way for the christening, while Primrose loses her heart to a very confused vicar. Pop gets a black eye, Edith Pilchester tackles a gang of roving Teddy boys and Mademoiselle Dupont begins to feel ill. Drama, starring David Jason, Pam Ferris and Catherine Zeta-Jones

programme.title: The Mayfair Hotel Megabuild
programme.desc: Documentary following a major construction project at Claridges, revealing the engineering challenges involved in digging out a five-storey basement, adding four new floors to the top of the hotel and creating Londons most expensive penthouse. In the first edition, Donegal miners work 24 hours a day to tunnel under the hotel by hand, while hotel manager Eugene tries hard to ensure loyal guests like David Walliams, Christian Louboutin and Damien Hirst remain undisturbed by the work going on above and below them

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Aaron finds what he is looking for, while Belle formulates a new plan and Bear is torn

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Feathers are ruffled among the staff as a new locum arrives at the hospital, while Ormerod treats the same boy twice in one day - but has difficulty acting on his own advice. Carnegie and Catherine struggle to shake off Ken and Alun during their first date at the races, until their full attention is claimed when a jockey falls from his horse on the track. Robert Cavanah and Amelia Curtis star

programme.title: Agatha Christies Marple
programme.sub-title: The Mirror Crackd from Side to Side
programme.desc: Hollywood actress Marina Gregg and her director husband take up residence at Gossington Hall in the village of St Mary Mead and hold a reception to meet their new neighbours, including the halls previous owner Dolly Bantry. The celebrations turn to tragedy, however, after a fan fatally drinks a poisoned cocktail apparently meant for the new lady of the manor. But a different picture begins to emerge as Marina spits out a similarly spiked cup of coffee on the set of her new film - and Miss Marple investigates the stars unhappy past. Julia McKenzie stars, with Lindsay Duncan, Nigel Harman, Joanna Lumley, Martin Jarvis, Hugh Bonneville and Michele Dotrice

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A beauty queen is targeted by mysterious attackers ahead of the Miss Yorkshire contest, which attracts more than the usual share of attention when busloads of female protesters turn up to picket the event. Ordered to boost his arrest record, Younger finds a novel way of raising the villages crime rate, while Phil spies an opportunity to get closer to Gina. Steven Blakeley and Mark Jordon star

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: The documentary continues with the investigation into the sinking of the Rainbow Warrior in May 1985. Just one day after the explosions that sunk the Greenpeace ship, police were overwhelmed with calls from people claiming to have spotted unusual goings on. One witness led to Swiss tourists Alain and Sophie Turenge. They came into the station voluntarily but their inability to answer simple questions led police to doubt their identities

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Becky schemes to stop Lisa from meeting up with Carla, Sarah suspects Theo of seeing Pete behind Todds back, Dev condemns Ashas friends for deserting her, and Debbie and Glenda disagree over the choirs repertoire

programme.title: The Night Caller
programme.desc: A vengeful Tony creeps into Lawrences house to face him. Lawrence thinks hes being burgled, until he recognises the intruder as the cabbie who picked him up earlier that night. He heads for the kitchen to call the police but theres a scuffle. Tony grabs a kitchen knife and Lawrence is forced to do what he says. Thriller, starring Robert Glenister

programme.title: Mum
programme.desc: In the finale series, Cathy and her family decamp to the English countryside to celebrate Dereks birthday. This time, the family are recovering from a party the night before, and as Cathy nurses a hangover, she learns that she and Michael were less than discreet in front of the others. Subtle comedy, starring Lesley Manville and Peter Mullan

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Bellamy chases joyriders tearing through Aidensfield and accidentally runs down Don Dibleys son during the pursuit. The boys father demands compensation, but soon realises his problems have just begun as his daughter reveals she is pregnant. Steve finds himself in trouble and David invents a novel way to rid the estate of moles. Rural drama, starring Mark Jordon, James Carlton and Ted Robbins

programme.desc: When a visiting chef is unable to relax, Cassie arranges for her to spend a whole day at the stove stirring a special recipe to quiet her mind

programme.desc: Doctors Helen Lawal and Javid Abdelmoneim help people try out the most popular diets on the market, with participants being put on a variety of regimens. Sisters Lesley and Debra from Essex road-test diets followed by celebrities Adele and Rebel Wilson, while friends Temi and Bose try out intermittent fasting, and drinking pals Maurice and Mick want to lose weight before attempting a Three Peaks walk in their native Yorkshire

programme.desc: Documentary following daily life at Chester Zoo. Two African black rhinos lock horns in a frightening lovers tiff. Rosie and Quinto take an instant dislike to each other and their keepers are forced to intervene

Also racing to catch their flight are a mother and daughter flying to South Africa to attend a close family relatives funeral. Emotions run high as time ticks away without the correct paperwork, so its down to Passenger Experience Manager Harry to come to the rescue - but is it already too late?

Adapted by Charlie Higson and co-starring Antony Sher, Robert Webb, Montserrat Lombard, Daniel Rigby, Hermione Norris, MyAnna Buring, Warren Brown and Oliver Ford Davies

programme.desc: Walker manages to arrest one member of a robber gang when a sting operation goes wrong - but ends up being taken hostage by the mans brother. programme.desc: Mercer and his associates are tried for their roles in the killing of 11-year-old Rhys Jones, but the verdict fails to bring closure for the boys parents Melanie and Steve as the fractures in their relationship come to a head. Meanwhile an unexpected setback leaves Det Supt Dave Kelly with a tough decision to make. The concluding part of the fact-based drama centred on the devastating impact of a childs murder amid a wave of gang violence in Liverpool, starring Stephen Graham, Sinead Keenan and Brían F OByrne
